newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - DMG initiates Argentine stocks.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - DMG initiates Argentine stocks.

text.p: -- Deutsche Morgan Grenfell initiated coverage of Argentine stocks with a recommended portfolio allocation weighted towards the oil, steel, food and financial sectors.

-- DMG saw oil giant YPF, Banco Francs, holding company Prez Companc, steelmakers Siderca and Siderar, foods firm Molinos and gas distributor Transportadora de Gas del Sur outperforming the market in 1997.

-- "Oil and gas output will continue to increase strongly driven by exports to the Mercosur region. Steel consumption will benefit from higher investments and oil production," a DMG news release said.

-- "Food companies have low production costs compared to their international peers and exports will remain strong. The financial sector will benefit as any increase in Argentina's economic growth will pass through the banking sector."
-- DMG's top sells were Telecom, utility Central Puerto and carmaker Sevel.

-- It forecast the blue-chip MerVal index .MERV, which closed Friday at 540 points, would rise to 610 within the next 12 months against a backdrop of GDP growth of 2.6 percent in 1996 and 3.0 percent in 1997, and a fiscal deficit at only two percent of GDP this year and one percent next year.

-- The bank said the MerVal is attractive at current levels and offers more potential than bonds for the next 12 months. It estimated real EPS growth of 12 percent in 1997 versus five percent in 1996 and a rise in operating margins to 17.4 percent in 1996 from 15.2 percent in 1995.
-- Consumer confidence should improve in 1997, with real wages easing 2.6 percent from 1996 but employment picking up to 12.3 million people from 12.1 million in 1996, DMG said.
-- It also predicted the government's package of tax hikes would pass Congress in October while labor reforms would be either approved by Congress or issued by decree next year.

-- "(President Carlos) Menem's ability to unify the Peronist party's strategy and the support from (Buenos Aires Governor Eduardo) Duhalde are key factors in assuring that economic reforms be approved by Congress in 1997," said DMG.
